text: Study Summary

We invite you to an anonymous user study of our web-based tool for design brainstorming on pressing societal issues. We aim to understand how to effectively design system features to engage stakeholders in discussions of societal issues at scale. The results of this study will be used to derive empirical design implications and published in research papers.
Empathy Questionnaire
Please answer the following questions regarding empathy.
Before criticizing somebody, I try to imagine how I would feel if I were in their place.
When I see someone being taken advantage of, I feel kind of protective toward them.
If I'm sure I'm right about something, I don't waste much time listening to other people's arguments.
When I see someone being treated unfairly, I sometimes don't feel very much pity for them.
I sometimes try to understand my friends better by imagining how things look from their perspective.
I often have tender, concerned feelings for people less fortunate than me.
I believe that there are two sides to every question and try to look at them both.
I would describe myself as a pretty soft-hearted person.
I sometimes find it difficult to see things from the other person's point of view.
Sometimes I don't feel sorry for other people when they are having problems.
I try to look at everybody's side of a disagreement before I make a decision.
Other people's misfortunes do not usually disturb me a great deal.
When I'm upset at someone, I usually try to put myself in their shoes for a while.
I am often quite touched by things that I see happen.
Sometimes I feel sorry for other people when they are having problems.
Demographic Questionnaire
Would you mind helping us understand the diversity, please?
What is your gender identity?
What is your age range?
What is your education level?
Back to Campus from COVID

The COVID-19 situation is still full of uncertainties. Even with vaccinations and other measures, the growth of the number of cases is not slowing down enough. Universities have decided to keep in place agile working approaches. While suggesting to work and study from home as much as possible, they allow people to return to the shared workplace. However, facility managers and people responsible for on-campus activities need to define working policies that both satisfy people's needs and government guidelines. To do so, they asked people working and studying on campus to express their opinion on this matter.
Imagine you are a Bachelor Student

You are a new Bachelor's student enrolled in UNIVERSITY. You just moved into a dorm on campus. You still keep in touch with high-school friends who live close to the campus. You have a private room and a shared common area for socializing. Besides attending courses and labs, you take a part-time job on campus to help with the tuition fees.
What is your opinion on the scenario, based on your assigned role?

choices.text: The university should allow people to work on campus without restrictions.
The university should have a tighter rule for people who work on campus, such as wearing masks.
The university should not allow people to work on campus, and all activities should be online.

text: Please describe why you choose the opinion.

Imagine you are a Master Student

You are a new Master's student enrolled in UNIVERSITY, and you come from abroad, and you don't know anyone. You live in a shared apartment with the other three tenants. In this semester you have lessons 4 days a week, all starting at 9 am. After lectures, you like to study in the public spaces of the campus.
What is your opinion on the scenario, based on your assigned role?

choices.text: The university should allow people to work on campus without restrictions.
The university should have a tighter rule for people who work on campus, such as wearing masks.
The university should not allow people to work on campus, and all activities should be online.

text: Please describe why you choose the opinion.

Imagine you are a PhD Student

You are a PhD student just enrolled in the graduate program of UNIVERSITY. You have weekly meetings with your supervisor and with the other PhD candidates. While the university provided you with a working laptop, you still need to access some facilities on campus to carry out your work (e.g., using laboratory equipment).
What is your opinion on the scenario, based on your assigned role?

choices.text: The university should allow people to work on campus without restrictions.
The university should have a tighter rule for people who work on campus, such as wearing masks.
The university should not allow people to work on campus, and all activities should be online.

Imagine you are a Researcher

You are a researcher working at UNIVERSITY. Your duties mainly include conducting research, meeting with colleagues, and doing small teaching activities, such as coaching students. You don't require any specific facility to carry out your work, but you do like the desk, chair, and monitor provided by the university (and the free coffee).
What is your opinion on the scenario, based on your assigned role?

choices.text: The university should allow people to work on campus without restrictions.
The university should have a tighter rule for people who work on campus, such as wearing masks.
The university should not allow people to work on campus, and all activities should be online.

Imagine you are a Professor

You are a professor working at UNIVERSITY. Your duties on campus include attending meetings with both colleagues and students, teaching courses, and conducting research. During the past year, you learned how to use several software tools to carry out your work in a remote setting.
What is your opinion on the scenario, based on your assigned role?

choices.text: The university should allow people to work on campus without restrictions.
The university should have a tighter rule for people who work on campus, such as wearing masks.
The university should not allow people to work on campus, and all activities should be online.

text: Please describe why you choose the opinion.
Rethink about Your Opinion
Please DO NOT hit the back button to go to the previous page to change your answers.
What is your opinion on the scenario, based on your assigned role, and after you take a look at other people's votes and motivations?

choices.text: The university should allow people to work on campus without restrictions. (5 people vote for this option)
The university should have a tighter rule for people who work on campus, such as wearing masks. (8 people vote for this option)
The university should not allow people to work on campus, and all activities should be online. (4 people vote for this option)
